alert.note: Alert for Jefferson; Orleans; Plaquemines (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 21 at 3:48PM CDT until May 21 at 9:00PM CDT by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Louisiana, including the following parishes, Jefferson, Orleans, Plaquemines and St. Bernard. * WHEN...Until 700 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 348 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 0.5 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... New Orleans, Timberlane, Harvey, Belle Chasse, Chalmette, Marrero, Avondale, Metairie, Jefferson, Gretna, Westwego, Terrytown, Woodmere, Arabi, Estelle, Meraux, Violet, Poydras and Bridge City. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
